meanings.sent1: He felt a tickle in his oxter.
meanings.sent2: She raised her arm to reveal her oxter.
meanings.sent3: The ticklish oxter made him giggle.
meanings.sent4: The scent of flowers wafted from her oxter.
meanings.sent5: The oxter is where deodorant is applied.

meanings.definition: To carry or support under the arm.
meanings.sent1: He would oxter the heavy bag for his friend.
meanings.sent2: She gently oxtered the injured bird to safety.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy knight tried to oxter the sword but dropped it.
meanings.sent4: She oxtered her books tightly against her side.
meanings.sent5: The farmer would oxter the hay bales to the barn.
